intro: Atylosia elongata, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant features slender, erect stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically pink to purple in color, attracting various pollinators. Atylosia elongata is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many plants in its family.
